title: Non-decreasing martingale couplings. (arXiv:2305.00565v1 [math.PR])
abstract:
For many examples of couples $(\mu,
u)$ of probability measures on the real line in the convex order, we observe numerically that the Hobson and Neuberger martingale coupling, which maximizes for $ho=1$ the integral of $|y-x|^ho$ with respect to any martingale coupling between $\mu$ and $
u$, is still a maximizer for $ho\in(0,2)$ and a minimizer for $ho>2$. We investigate the theoretical validity of this numerical observation and give rather restrictive sufficient conditions for the property to hold. We also exhibit couples $(\mu,
u)$ such that it does not hold. The support of the Hobson and Neuberger coupling is known to satisfy some monotonicity property which we call non-decreasing. We check that the non-decreasing property is preserved for maximizers when $ho\in(0,1]$. In general, there exist distinct non-decreasing martingale couplings, and we find some decomposition of $

translated_abstract:
对于许多实数集上的概率测度对$(\mu, 
u)$而言，在凸序中，我们从数字实验中发现最大化由任何$\mu$和$
u $之间的鞅耦合的$|y-x|^ho$积分而得到$ho=1$时Hobson和Neuberger鞅耦合仍然是$ho\in(0,2)$的最大化值和$ho>2$的最小化值。我们研究了这个数字观察到的理论有效性并提出了相当具有限制性的充分条件。我们还展示了一些这个性质不成立的$(\mu, 
u)$，已知Hobson和Neuberger耦合的支持满足某种称为非降的单调性质。我们检查了当$ho\in(0,1]$时，最大化这个积分值的非降性质得以保留。总的来说，存在不同的非降鞅耦合，并且我们发现$
u $的某些分解与特定的非降鞅耦合一一对应。
tldr: 该论文研究了实数集上的概率测度对$(\mu, \nu)$的非降鞅耦合问题，提出了一些充分条件，并证明了最大化$|y-x|^\rho$积分值的非降性质得以保留，但存在不同的非降鞅耦合。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the problem of non-decreasing martingale couplings for probability measures on the real line, provides some sufficient conditions and proves that the non-decreasing property of the maximum value of the integral of $|y-x|^\rho$ is preserved, while there are distinct non-decreasing martingale couplings.
